intro: Sida elongata, commonly known as the slender sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate in shape and often have a hairy texture. Sida elongata is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
